intro: Cyphostemma grahamii, commonly known as the Graham's cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
